-- Using valid SQLite, answer the following questions for the tables provided above.

-- How many singers do we have?How many singers do we have?. 
SELECT
response:
COUNT(*) AS singers_count
FROM singer

-- How many concerts do we have? How many concerts do we have? 
SELECT
COUNT(*) AS concerts_count
FROM concert

-- We have 2 singers and 3 concerts. How many songs did they sing? 
SELECT
COUNT(*) AS songs_count
FROM singer, concert
WHERE singer.concert_ID = concert.concert_ID

-- We have 2 singers and 3 concerts. How many stadiums did they sing in? 
SELECT
COUNT(*) AS stadiums_count
FROM singer, concert, stadium
WHERE singer.concert_ID = concert.concert_ID
AND singer.stadium_ID = stadium.stadium_ID

-- We have 2 singers and 3 concerts. How much money did they make? 
SELECT
SUM(amount) AS total_amount
FROM singer, concert
WHERE singer.concert_ID = concert.concert_ID

-- What are the names and ages of all students in the database?
SELECT
    Student.LName, Student.Fname, Student.Age, Major.Advisor, city_code
FROM
    Student
    INNER JOIN Major ON Major.StuId = Student.StuId
    INNER JOIN city_code ON city_code.StuCity = Student.City
    INNER JOIN Pets ON Pets.PetId = Major.PetId
    WHERE
        Student.Fname IS NOT NULL
    LIMIT 3;

  height as Cylinders,
  weight as Weight,
  accelerate as Horsepower,
  avg(weight) as AverageWeight

FROM model_list
GROUP BY model_list.ModelId, model_list

	, count(distinct maker) as maker_count

FROM (
	SELECT modelid, model, maker, count(*) as version_count, round(100.0 * count(*) / max(count(*)), 2) as version_percentage
	FROM car_makers
		JOIN cars_data ON cars_data.modelid = car_makers.modelid
		JOIN continents ON continents.continentid = cars_data.continentid
		JOIN countries ON countries.countryid = continents.continentid
		JOIN model_list ON model_list.modelid = car_makers.modelid

	GROUP BY 1, 2

	) t

WHERE t.modelid NOT IN (
	SELECT modelid
	FROM model_list
	WHERE maker!= 'bmw'
	)

GROUP BY 1, 2

HAVING count(*) > 1

-- How many car makers has more than 3 models?How many car makers has more than 3 models?. 
SELECT

  SubQueryAlias.ContId AS maker_id,
  Count(*) AS model_count
FROM

    (
        SELECT
            ModelId AS MakerId, Model AS Model
        FROM model_list
        GROUP BY
            ModelId
    ) SubQuerySubOne

    INNER JOIN
    (
        SELECT
            ModelId AS MakerId, Count(*) AS ModelCount
        FROM model_list
        GROUP BY
            ModelId
    ) SubQuerySubTwo

        ON SubQuerySubOne.ModelId = SubQuerySubTwo.ModelId

GROUP BY

  SubQueryAlias.ContId

HAVING
    SubQuerySubOne.ModelCount > 3

  shops.name,
  shops.location,
  shops.district,
  employee.name as employee_name,
  employee.age as employee_age,
  employee.city as employee_city,
  bonus.year_awarded,
  bonus.bonus as bonus_awarded
FROM shops
JOIN employee ON employee.shop_id = shops.shop_id
JOIN evaluation ON employee.employee_id = evaluation.employee_id
JOIN hiring ON employee.employee_id = hiring.employee_id
JOIN bonus ON hiring.year_awarded = bonus.year_awarded
where shops.district = 'Helsinki'
AND employee.age < 10;

LIMIT 3;

-- Find the highest rank of losers in all matches.Find the highest rank of losers in all matches..

response:

round,

    )
)

response:

-- What are the first, middle, and last names, along with the ids, of all students who enrolled in 2 degree programs in one semester?What are the first, middle, and last names, along with the ids, of all students who enrolled in 2 degree programs in one semester?. 
SELECT
response:
first_name,
middle_name,
last_name,
current_address_id,
permanent_address_id,
first_name as permanent_first_name,
middle_name as permanent_middle_name,
last_name as permanent_last_name

FROM Students 
INNER JOIN Degree_Programs ON Students.degree_program_id = Degree_Programs.degree_program_id
INNER JOIN Departments ON Degree_Programs.department_id = Departments.department_id
INNER JOIN Sections ON Departments.section_id = Sections.section_id
INNER JOIN Semesters ON Sections.semester_id = Semesters.semester_id
INNER JOIN Student_Enrolment ON Students.student_id = Student_Enrolment.student_id
INNER JOIN Student_Enrolment_Courses ON Student_Enrolment.student_course_id = Student_Enrolment_Courses.student_course_id
INNER JOIN Course_Enrolments ON Course_Enrolments.course_id = Degree_Programs.course_id
INNER JOIN Students ON Course

-- Find the last name of the students who currently live in the state of North Carolina but have not registered in any degree program.Find the last name of the students who currently live in the state of North Carolina but have not registered in any degree program.. 
SELECT
response:
-- If the student has a permanent address in North Carolina, their last name is Balistreri. If the student has a permanent address outside of North Carolina, their last name is Gleichner. 
first_name
last_name
cell_mobile_number
ssn
date_first_registered
date_left
other_student_details.other_details
FROM Students 
INNER JOIN Course_Enrolment_Mappings 
    ON Students.student_id = Course_Enrolment_Mappings.student_course_id
INNER JOIN Student_Enrolment 
    ON Course_Enrolment_Mappings.course_id = Student_Enrolment.course_id
INNER JOIN Departments 
    ON Student_Enrolment.department_id = Departments.department_id
INNER JOIN Courses 
    ON Course_Enrolment_Mappings.course_id = Courses.course_id
INNER JOIN Degrees 
    ON Student_Enrolment.degree_program_id = Degrees.degree_program_id
INNER JOIN Degrees_Qualifications 
    ON Degrees.degree_id = Deg

-- What is the series name and country of all TV channels that are playing cartoons directed by Ben Jones and cartoons directed by Michael Chang?What is the series name and country of all TV channels that are playing cartoons directed by Ben Jones and cartoons directed by Michael Chang?. 
SELECT
response:
series_name,

FROM TV_Channel
JOIN Cartoon
ON TV_Channel.idseries_name = Cartoon.Title
JOIN Cartoon
ON TV_Channel.idseries_name = Cartoon.Directed_by
JOIN Cartoon

-- What is the average earnings of poker players?What is the average earnings of poker players?. 
SELECT
response:
AVG(Earnings) 
  AS Average_Earnings
  FROM people p
  JOIN poker_player p1 ON p.People_ID=p1.People_ID
  JOIN poker_player p2 ON p.People_ID=p2.People_ID
  JOIN poker_player p3 ON p.People_ID=p3.People_ID
  GROUP BY p1.People_ID, p2.People_ID, p3.People_ID
  HAVING COUNT(1) > 1

-- Give the percentage of official language usage for countries in Angola.
SELECT
    Count(name) AS Count,
    name AS CountryCode,
    language AS Language,
    IsOfficial AS Percentage
FROM countrylanguage
WHERE countrycode = 'AGO'
GROUP BY countrycode, language
ORDER BY Count DESC, IsOfficial DESC;

-- Give the name of the official language used in Angola.
SELECT
    Count(name) AS Count,
    name AS CountryCode,
    language AS Language
FROM countrylanguage
WHERE countrycode = 'AGO'
GROUP BY countrycode
ORDER BY Count DESC, language;

-- Give the capital city of Angola in both official language and local language.
SELECT
    Count(name) AS Count,
    name AS CountryCode,
    language AS Language,
    Capital AS City
FROM countrylanguage
WHERE country

SELECT
    c.Name as Name,
    c.Code as CountryCode,
    c.Country as Country,
    c.IndepYearPopulation as IndepYearPopulation,
    avg(c.GNP) as GNP,
    round(sum(c.Population), 0) as TotalPopulation
from
    country c
group by
    c.Name,
    c.Code,
    c.Country,
    c.IndepYearPopulation

    CountryCode,
    Country,

-- Return the city name and the population of each city that is a capital of a country with at least 3 languages spoken for it.
SELECT
    name,
     Population
FROM
    city
    JOIN (SELECT
            name,
            countrycode,
            COUNT(*) AS cnt
        FROM
            countrylanguage
            JOIN country ON countrylanguage.countrycode = country.code
        GROUP BY
            code, name) AS countrycountries ON city.countrycode = countrycountries.countrycode AND countrycountries.cnt >= 3
    JOIN country ON country.code = countrycountries.countrycode
WHERE
    city.name IN (SELECT name FROM sqlite_sequence WHERE name = 'city')
    AND name NOT IN (SELECT DISTINCT name FROM countrylanguage WHERE is Official = 'T')

(2, 'Qandahar', 'AFG', 'Qandahar', 237500)
(3, 'Herat', 'AFG', 'Herat', 186800)
*/
SELECT
    name,
    surfacearea
FROM
    country,
    city,
    countrylanguage,
     sqlite_sequence
WHERE
    country.code = city.CountryCode
    AND city.CountryCode = countrylanguage.CountryCode
    AND countrylanguage.Language = 'Dutch'
    AND sqlite_sequence.name = country.seq
    AND sqlite_sequence.seq = city.seq
ORDER BY
    name,
    surfacearea DESC
LIMIT 3;
-- Kabul, Qandahar, Herat

SELECT
(SELECT name FROM country WHERE population= (SELECT min(population) FROM country)) AS lowest_populated_nation,
(SELECT name FROM country WHERE population=(SELECT min(population) FROM country) + 1) AS next_lowest_populated_nation,

FROM country;

(SELECT name FROM countrylanguage WHERE population=(SELECT min(population) FROM countrylanguage) + 1)

name,
age,
nationality,
year_of_work,

    WHERE c1.name = conductor.name
    LIMIT 1

    WHERE c1.name = conductor.name
    LIMIT 2
) as longest_years_worked_as_conductor

-- Find the total number of owners, dogs, and treatment types for each of the three Breeds. 
-- Assuming that this data has been stored in the Dog, Breeds, and Treatment_Types tables, 
-- the following query can be used to find the total number of dogs, owners, and treatment types.
-- 
SELECT * 
FROM Dogs
    INNER JOIN Breeds
        ON Dogs.breed_code = Breeds.breed_code
    INNER JOIN Charges
        ON Dogs.dog_id = Charges.dog_id
    INNER JOIN Owners
        ON Dogs.owner_id = Owners.owner_id
    INNER JOIN Professionals
        ON Dogs.professional_id = Professionals.professional_id
    INNER JOIN Sizes
        ON Dogs.size_code = Sizes.size_code
    INNER JOIN Treatment_Types
        ON Dogs.treatment

-- Which dogs have not cost their owner more than 1000 for treatment ? List the dog names .Which dogs have not cost their owner more than 1000 for treatment ? List the dog names ..

response:

first_name +'' + last_name AS owner_name,
street,
city,
state,
zip_code,
email_address,
home_phone,
cell_number,
treatments.cost_of_treatment

FROM
Dogs
LEFT JOIN Owners
ON Dogs.dog_id = Owners.owner_id
LEFT JOIN Professionals
ON Owners.professional_id = Professionals.professional_id
LEFT JOIN Treatments
ON Dogs.dog_id = Treatments.dog_id

WHERE
treatments.cost_of_treatment < 1000

ORDER BY
treatments.cost_of_treatment DESC
, dog_id ASC

street
FROM Owners
WHERE type IN ('Employee', 'Professionals')
GROUP BY professional_id, role_code, street
HAVING count(*) > 1;

-- How many professionals administered any treatments?How many professionals administered any treatments?.
SELECT

 d.professional_id
, count(*)
FROM Treatments tt
INNER JOIN Owners o ON tt.owner_id = o.owner_id
INNER JOIN Professionals p ON tt.professional_id = p.professional_id
INNER JOIN Breeds b ON tt.breed_code = b.breed_code
WHERE o.owner_id IS NOT NULL
AND p.professional_id IS NOT NULL
AND b.breed_code IN ('ESK', 'BUL', 'HUS', 'BOL', 'HUS', 'BUL', 'ESK', 'BOL')
AND tt.treatment_type_code IN ('VAC', 'EXAM', 'WALK')
AND tt.date_of_treatment >= '2018-03-08'
AND tt.date_of_treatment <  '2018-03-19'
GROUP BY d.professional_id
HAVING count(*) > 0
